shortdesc.ph: Used to set channel media options.
Configures media publishing and subscription options in the channel.

section.p: Supports publishing multiple audio streams and one video stream simultaneously in the same . For example, you can set publishMicrophoneTrack, publishCustomAudioTrack, and publishMediaPlayerAudioTrack to at the same time, but only one of publishCameraTrack, publishScreenCaptureVideo, publishScreenTrack, publishCustomVideoTrack, or publishEncodedVideoTrack can be set to .

Supports publishing multiple audio streams and one video stream simultaneously within the same . For example, you can enable publishMicrophoneTrack, publishCustomAudioTrack, and publishMediaPlayerAudioTrack at the same time, but only one of publishCameraTrack, publishScreenCaptureVideo, publishCustomVideoTrack, and publishEncodedVideoTrack can be set to .
section.note: We recommend that you set the member parameters according to your business scenario. Otherwise, the SDK automatically assigns values to them.
It is recommended that you set the values of each member parameter according to your business scenario; otherwise, the SDK will assign default values automatically.

plentry.pd:
Whether to publish the video captured by the camera:
: Publish the camera video.
: Do not publish the camera video.

Whether to publish the video captured by the secondary camera:
: Publish the secondary camera video.
: Do not publish the secondary camera video.

pd.note: (Android, Windows, and macOS only)
pd.ph: Whether to publish the video captured by the third camera:

ul.li: : Do not publish the third camera video.

pd.note: (Android, Windows, and macOS only)
pd.ph: Whether to publish the video captured by the fourth camera:

ul.li: : Do not publish the fourth camera video.

plentry.pd:
Whether to publish the audio captured by the microphone:
: Publish the microphone audio.
: Do not publish the microphone audio.

pd.note: (Android and iOS only)
pd.ph: Whether to publish the video captured from the screen:

ul.li: : Do not publish the screen video.

pd.note: (Android and iOS only)
pd.ph: Whether to publish the audio captured from the screen:

ul.li: : Do not publish the screen audio.

pd.note: (Windows and macOS only)
pd.ph: Whether to publish the video captured from the screen:

ul.li: : Do not publish the screen video.

plentry.pd:
Whether to publish the video captured from the second screen:
: Publish the second screen video.
: Do not publish the second screen video.

pd.note: (Windows and macOS only)
pd.ph: Whether to publish the video captured from the third screen:

ul.li: : Do not publish the third screen video.

pd.note: (Windows and macOS only)
pd.ph: Whether to publish the video captured from the fourth screen:

ul.li: : Do not publish the fourth screen video.

plentry.pd:
Whether to publish the audio from a custom audio source:
: Publish the custom audio.
: Do not publish the custom audio.
The ID of the custom audio track to publish. Default is 0. You can get the custom audio track ID by calling .

Whether to publish the video from a custom video source:
: Publish the custom video.
: Do not publish the custom video.

Whether to publish the encoded video:
: Publish the encoded video.
: Do not publish the encoded video.

Whether to publish the audio from the media player:
: Publish the media player audio.
: Do not publish the media player audio.

Whether to publish the video from the media player:
: Publish the media player video.
: Do not publish the media player video.

pd.note: Since v4.2.0, the parameter name has been corrected from publishTrancodedVideoTrack to publishTranscodedVideoTrack.
pd.ph: Whether to publish the local transcoded video:

ul.li: : Do not publish the local transcoded video.

plentry.pd:
Whether to publish the mixed audio track:
: Publish the mixed audio track.
: Do not publish the mixed audio track.

Whether to publish the video track processed by voice-driven extension:
: Publish the video track processed by voice-driven extension.
: (Default) Do not publish the video track processed by voice-driven extension.

Whether to automatically subscribe to all remote audio streams when joining a channel:
: Subscribe to all remote audio streams.
: Do not automatically subscribe to any remote audio streams.

Whether to automatically subscribe to all remote video streams when joining a channel:
: Subscribe to all remote video streams.
: Do not automatically subscribe to any remote video streams.

pd.note: If you want to publish microphone audio, make sure this parameter is set to .
pd.ph: Whether to enable audio recording or playout:

ul.li: : Do not enable recording or playout.

plentry.pd: The ID of the media player to publish. Default is 0.

User role. See . If the user role is set to audience, you cannot publish audio or video streams in the channel. If you want to publish media streams in a live broadcast, make sure to set the user role to broadcaster.
Latency level for audience in interactive live streaming. See .
Default video stream type. See .
Channel profile. See .
Delay in sending audio frames (in ms). You can use this parameter to delay audio frames to ensure audio-video sync. Set to 0 to disable delay.
Delay in sending media player audio frames (in ms). Used to explicitly control audio-video sync. Set to 0 to disable delay.

(Optional) Token for authentication generated on your server.
This parameter takes effect only when calling or .
Make sure the App ID, channel name, and user name used to generate the token are the same as those used in the , joinChannel, and methods.

pd.note: Ignored when calling .
pd.ph: Whether to enable media packet encryption:

plentry.pd:
Whether to publish the metronome sound to remote users:
: Publish the processed audio frame. Both local and remote users can hear the metronome.
: Do not publish the metronome sound. Only the local user can hear it.

ul.li: This parameter applies only to co-hosted live streaming scenarios. Co-hosts must call to join another host's channel as an audience and set isInteractiveAudience to true.
This parameter takes effect only when the user role is CLIENT_ROLE_AUDIENCE.

pd.ph: Whether to enable interactive mode:

plentry.pd: The video track ID returned by calling . Default is 0.

pd.note: To enable this feature, contact technical support.
pd.ph: Whether to filter the published audio stream based on volume algorithm:

ul.li: : Audio stream is filtered. This setting has no effect if audio stream filtering is not enabled.

pd.note:
Permissions and system requirements:
Android: Android 7.0 or later (API level 24+), requires ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE and CHANGE_NETWORK_STATE permissions.
iOS: iOS 12.0 or later.
macOS: 10.14 or later.
Windows: Windows Vista or later.
pd.ph: Whether to enable multipath transmission:

plentry.pd: Uplink transmission mode. See . Make sure enableMultipath is set to true when using this parameter.
Downlink transmission mode. See . Make sure enableMultipath is set to true when using this parameter.
Preferred path type for transmission. See . Make sure enableMultipath is set to true when using this parameter.

Whether to publish the video captured by the camera:
: Publish the video captured by the camera.
: Do not publish the video captured by the camera.

Whether to publish the second camera video track:
: Publish the second camera video track.
: (Default) Do not publish the second camera video track.

Whether to publish the third camera video:
: Publish the third camera video.
: Do not publish the third camera video.

Whether to publish the fourth camera video:
: Publish the fourth camera video.
: Do not publish the fourth camera video.

Whether to publish the audio captured by the microphone:
: Publish the audio captured by the microphone.
: Do not publish the audio captured by the microphone.

pd.note: Since v4.0.0, the parameter has been renamed from publishScreenTrack to publishScreenCaptureVideo.
pd.ph: Whether to publish the video captured from the screen:

ul.li: : Do not publish the screen capture video.

plentry.pd:
Whether to publish the audio captured from the screen:
: Publish the screen capture audio.
: Do not publish the screen capture audio.

Whether to publish audio captured from a custom audio source:
: Publish audio from a custom audio source.
: Do not publish audio from a custom audio source.
The ID of the custom audio track to publish. You can obtain this ID via the method.

Whether to publish the video captured from a custom video source:
: Publish video from a custom video source.
: Do not publish video from a custom video source.

Whether to publish the encoded video:
: Publish the encoded video.
: Do not publish the encoded video.

Whether to publish the audio from the media player:
: Publish the audio from the media player.
: Do not publish the audio from the media player.

Whether to publish the video from the media player:
: Publish the video from the media player.
: Do not publish the video from the media player.

Whether to publish the locally transcoded video track:
: Publish the locally transcoded video track.
: (Default) Do not publish the locally transcoded video track.

Whether to publish the mixed audio track:
: Publish the mixed audio track.
: Do not publish the mixed audio track.

Whether to publish the video track processed by voice-driven extension:
: Publish the video track processed by voice-driven extension.
: (Default) Do not publish the video track processed by voice-driven extension.

Whether to automatically subscribe to all remote audio streams when a user joins the channel:
: Subscribe to all remote audio streams.
: Do not automatically subscribe to any remote audio streams.

Whether to automatically subscribe to all remote video streams when a user joins the channel:
: Subscribe to all remote video streams.
: Do not automatically subscribe to any remote video streams.

pd.note: To publish audio from the microphone, ensure this parameter is set to .
pd.ph: Whether to enable audio recording or playback:

ul.li: : Do not enable audio recording or playback.

plentry.pd: The ID of the media player to publish. Default is 0.

pd.note: If the user role is set to audience, you cannot publish audio or video streams in the channel. To publish media streams during a live broadcast, ensure the user role is set to broadcaster.
pd.ph: User role type:

plentry.pd:
Latency level for audience in interactive live streaming:
AUDIENCE_LATENCY_LEVEL_LOW_LATENCY (1): Low latency.
AUDIENCE_LATENCY_LEVEL_ULTRA_LOW_LATENCY (2): Ultra-low latency (default).

Default video stream type:
VIDEO_STREAM_HIGH (0): High-quality video stream with high resolution and high bitrate.
VIDEO_STREAM_LOW (1): Low-quality video stream with low resolution and low bitrate.

pd.note: Deprecated since v4.x.x. Use CHANNEL_PROFILE_LIVE_BROADCASTING instead.
pd.ph: Channel profile:

ul.li: CHANNEL_PROFILE_COMMUNICATION (0): Communication profile. Agora recommends using the live broadcast profile for better audio and video experience.
CHANNEL_PROFILE_CLOUD_GAMING (3): Interactive profile. This profile is optimized for low latency and suitable for scenarios requiring frequent interaction between users.

plentry.pd: Delay (in milliseconds) for sending audio frames. You can use this parameter to synchronize audio and video. To disable delay, set this value to 0.
Delay (in milliseconds) for sending media player audio frames, used for explicit audio-video synchronization. To disable delay, set this value to 0.

(Optional) The token generated by your server for authentication. This parameter is only effective when calling updateChannelMediaOptions or updateChannelMediaOptionsEx. Ensure that the App ID, channel name, and user name used to generate the token are consistent with those used in create to initialize the RTC engine and in joinChannel and joinChannelEx to join the channel.

pd.note: This setting is ignored when calling updateChannelMediaOptions.
pd.ph: Whether to enable media packet encryption:

ul.li: : (Default) Do not enable media packet encryption.

plentry.pd:
Whether to publish the metronome sound to remote users:
: Publish the processed audio frames so both local and remote users can hear the metronome.
: Do not publish the metronome sound; only the local user can hear it.

pd.note: This parameter is only applicable in co-hosting scenarios. A co-host must call joinChannelEx to join another host's channel as an audience and set isInteractiveAudience to . This parameter is only effective when the user role is CLIENT_ROLE_AUDIENCE.
pd.ph: Whether to enable interactive mode:

plentry.pd: The video track ID returned by calling the createCustomVideoTrack method. Default is 0.

pd.note: To enable this feature, contact technical support.
pd.ph: Whether the published audio stream is filtered based on volume algorithm:

ul.li: : The audio stream will be filtered.
: The audio stream will not be filtered.

plentry.pd:
Whether to start preview when joining the channel if the canvas is already set:
: (Default) Start preview when joining the channel.
: Do not start preview.

pd.note: Permissions and system requirements: Android 7.0 or later (API level 24 or higher), requires ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE and CHANGE_NETWORK_STATE permissions.
pd.ph: Whether to enable multipath transmission:

plentry.pd: Uplink transmission mode. See . To use this parameter, ensure enableMultipath is set to .
Downlink transmission mode. See . To use this parameter, ensure enableMultipath is set to .
Preferred transmission path type. See . To use this parameter, ensure enableMultipath is set to .
